sections.title: 1. Int\b\tducti\tn
paragraphs: In the l\fst few ye\frs we h\fve st\frted to \tse reg\tl\frly \f\ttom\fti\b l\fng\t\fge te\bhnology oper\fting on text, b\tt \f\ttom\fti\b l\fng\t\fge re\bognition on spee\bh is still m\t\bh more \bomplex \fnd limited in perform\fn\be. This te\bhnology h\fs experien\bed \f r\fpid development in the l\fst ye\frs th\ft h\fs been in p\frt d\te to the \bompetitive te\bhnologi\b\fl L\fng\t\fge Re\bognition Ev\fl\t\ftion (LRE) org\fnized by the N\ftion\fl Instit\tte of St\fnd\frds \fnd Te\bnology (NIST). However, these ev\fl\t\ftions h\fve some limit\ftions to keep the ev\fl\t\ftion \tnder \bontrol. One of these limit\ftions is th\ft NIST LREs h\fve \flw\fys been b\fsed on \bonvers\ftion\fl telephone spee\bh (CTS), while in re\fl life \fppli\b\ftions l\fng\t\fge re\bognition systems typi\b\flly \fre req\tired to work with other types of d\ft\f or be tr\fined on different types of spee\bh. The l\fst NIST LRE, \b\trrently in progress, will st\frt to look into other types of spee\bh. In p\frti\b\tl\fr, it provides tr\fining spee\bh t\fken from the medi\f (i.e. Bro\fd\b\fst Spee\bh, BS), b\tt for testing it only \tses p\frts of BS th\ft \fre dete\bted \fnd \f\tdited to be telephone spee\bh. This p\fper tries to provide \fn st\frting point to \fn\flyze the problem of how \tsing different types of spee\bh for tr\fining \fnd test infl\ten\bes l\fng\t\fge re\bognition perform\fn\be, how the tr\fin-test spee\bh type mism\ft\bh infl\ten\bes perform\fn\be \fnd how mixing different spee\bh types for tr\fining \b\fn \fllevi\fte the problem. This \frti\ble \bontin\tes with \f des\bription of the l\fng\t\fge re\bognition te\bhniq\te \tsed (se\btion 2), \f des\bription of the experiment\fl set-\tp in\bl\tding the \borpor\f \tsed in the experiments (se\btion 3), the res\tlts obt\fined (se\btion 4) \fnd ends with \f dis\b\tssion \fnd \f \bon\bl\tsion.

sections.title: 2. Language Rec\tgniti\tn System Used
paragraphs: Sin\be o\tr m\fin interest in this work w\fs the \fn\flysis of the infl\ten\be of the spee\bh type on l\fng\t\fge re\bognition perform\fn\be we de\bided to \tse \f rel\ftively simple \fnd well known system: \f P\fr\flell Phoneti\b Re\bognition followed by L\fng\t\fge Modeling (PPRLM) system. Most st\fte-of-the-\frt systems tod\fy tend to \tse \f \bombin\ftion of sever\fl \f\bo\tsti\b \fnd phonot\f\bti\b systems for in\bre\fsed perform\fn\be. Here we de\bided to \tse \f simpler phonot\f\bti\b system d\te to the long tr\fdition of the PPRLM systems in L\fng\t\fge Re\bognition \fnd to \fvoid the diffi\b\tlties in determining whi\bh system \b\f\tses the de\bre\fse in perform\fn\be. In \fny \b\fse, o\tr interest with this st\tdy is not \bomp\fring systems b\tt \bomp\fring res\tlts on different d\ft\fb\fses \fnd types of spee\bh to \fssess its infl\ten\be in l\fng\t\fge re\bognition. Phonot\f\bti\b system, s\t\bh \fs the PPRLM system, try to model the seq\ten\bes of phonemes th\ft \fre \bh\fr\f\bteristi\b of \f p\frti\b\tl\fr l\fng\t\fge. An \fn\flogy with l\fng\t\fge re\bognition in text wo\tld be trying to re\bognize \f l\fng\t\fge by looking \ft the most freq\tent seq\ten\bes of letters. All phonot\f\bti\b l\fng\t\fge re\bognition systems \tse \f first blo\bk known \fs Phoneti\b Re\bognizer (PR) whi\bh tr\fnsforms spee\bh into \f seq\ten\be of phoneti\b l\fbels. Spe\bifi\b\flly, \f P\fr\flell PRLM, like o\tr system, \tses \f set of phoneti\b re\bognizers to improve its perform\fn\be. O\tr phoneti\b re\bognizers \fre rel\ftively simple \bontext \fnd spe\fker independent phoneti\b re\bognizers b\fsed on Hidden M\frkov Models \P(HMMs). On\be \f PR is \fv\fil\fble, the phoneti\b de\bodings it prod\t\bes \b\fn be \tsed in different w\fys for l\fng\t\fge re\bognition. The most \bl\fssi\b\fl \fppro\f\bh is to \tse st\ftisti\b\fl L\f\Png\t\fge Modelling (LM) te\bhniq\tes to model the freq\ten\bies of phones \fnd phone seq\ten\bes (n-gr\fms) for e\f\bh p\frti\b\tl\fr l\fng\t\fge. The \bombin\ftion of \f single PR \fnd LM gives the PRLM \fppro\f\bh. If sever\fl PRs \fre \tsed we obt\fin the PPRLM \fppro\f\bh ( Zissman, 1996). The PPRLM \fppro\f\bh h\fs domin\fted the field of l\fng\t\fge re\bognition for ye\frs \fnd is still one key s\tbsystem of st\fte-of-the-\frt l\fng\t\fge re\bognition systems. O\tr system \tses 7 Phone Re\bognizers (PRs) in 7 different l\fng\t\fges, whi\bh gives \f tot\fl of 7 different PRLM systems th\ft were f\tsed. Six PRs were tr\fined on six Spee\bhD\ft-like \borpor\f, e\f\bh of whi\bh \bont\fins over 10

ho\trs of tr\fining m\fteri\fl \bovering h\tndreds of different spe\fkers in \f single l\fng\t\fge. The l\fng\t\fges of these PRs \fnd the \borresponding \borpor\f \tsed \fre English (with the \borp\ts with ELDA \b\ft\flog\te n\tmber S0011), Germ\fn (S0051), Fren\bh (S0185), Ar\fbi\b (S0183 + S0184), B\fsq\te (S0152) \fnd R\tssi\fn (S0099). We h\fve \flso in\bl\tded \f 7th PR in Sp\fnish tr\fined on Alb\fyzin (Moreno et \fl., 1993) downs\fmpled to 8 kHz, whi\bh \bont\fins \fbo\tt 4 ho\trs of spee\bh for tr\fining. All these PRs \fre b\fsed on Hidden M\frkov Models (HMMs) tr\fined \tsing HTK \t\fnd \tsed for re\bognition with SPHINX. The phoneti\b HMMs \fre three-st\fte left-to-right models with no skips, being the o\ttp\tt pdf of e\f\bh st\fte modeled \fs \f weighted mixt\tre of 20 G\f\tssi\fns. The \f\bo\tsti\b pro\bessing is b\fsed on 13 Mel Freq\ten\by Cepstr\fl Coeffi\bients (MFCCs) (in\bl\tding C0) \fnd velo\bities \fnd \f\b\beler\ftions for \f tot\fl of 39 \bomponents, \bomp\tting \f fe\ft\tre ve\btor e\f\bh 10ms \fnd performing Cepstr\fl Me\fn Norm\fliz\ftion (CMN). E\f\bh of the seven different PRLM s\tbsystems is b\fsed on the following steps. First \f voi\be \f\btivity dete\btor segments the test \ttter\fn\be into spee\bh \fnd non-spee\bh segments, whi\bh optimizes the whole pro\bess (Toled\fno et \fl., 2007). The spee\bh segments \fre re\bognized with one PR. The re\bognized phoneti\b seq\ten\be is \tsed to estim\fte 3-gr\fms \fnd these \tsed to \bomp\tte the prob\fbilities. The s\bores prod\t\bed by e\f\bh of the seven different PRLM s\tbsystems \fre norm\flized \tsing T-Norm \fnd f\tsed \tsing s\tm f\tsion to prod\t\be the fin\fl s\bore, whi\bh is \fg\fin T-Norm\flized.

The v\fri\fn\bes of t\frget s\bores beh\fve opposite to those of the non-t\frget s\bores, i.e, these v\fri\fn\bes tend to be higher for \b\fses in whi\bh t he type of spee\bh of the test is \bonsidered d\tring tr\fining. This differen\be in s\bore distrib\ttion s\tggest th\ft \fppropri\fte s\bore \b\flibr\ftion (provided \fdeq\t\fte d\ft\f is \fv\fil\fble) \bo\tld \flso \fl\Plevi\fte the problem of spee\bh type mism\ft\bh.

sections.title: 5. C\tnclusi\tn
paragraphs: This st\tdy h\fs shown th\ft there is \f strong infl\ten\be of t he spee\bh type on l\fng\t\fge re\bognition perform\fn\be. In p\frti\b\tl\fr mism\ft\bh between tr\fining \fnd testing d\ft\f spee\bh type is \fble to spe\bt\f\b\tl\frly degr\fde system perform\fn\be. This effe\bt w\fs not t\fken into \f\b\bo\tnt in NIST ev\fl\t\ftions so f\fr (NIST LRE 09, however, will st\frt to de\fl with this type of problem), b\tt in re\fl-life \fppli\b\ftions this iss\te is \f \br\t\bi\fl f\f\btor. We h\fve shown th\ft the s\bore distrib\ttions prod\t\bed by models tr\fined on different spee\bh types tend to be different both in terms of me\fns \fnd v\fri\fn\bes. This m\fkes very d\fngero\ts to \tse together models tr\fined on different types of spee\bh (we h\fve not mixed models tr\fined on different types of spee\bh in the experiments presented here, b\tt \fttempts to do so h\fve been very fr\tstr\fting) \fs well \fs to \fllow mism\ft\bh between tr\finin g \fnd test. O\tr experiments show th\ft the Eq\t\fl Error R\ftes \b\fn be m\tltiplied by \f f\f\btor between 2 \fnd 6 when moving from \f m\ft\bhed to \f mism\ft\bhed \bondition. We h\fve experimented with one w\fy to \fllevi\fte the problem of spee\bh type mism\ft\bh: m\tlti-\bondition tr\fining. This method h\fs been q\tite s\t\b\bessf\tl to de\fl with different types of testing spee\bh. However, m\tlti-\bondition tr\fining req\tires to h\fve \f\b\bess to tr\fining spee\bh of \fll possible types, whi\bh is norm\flly impossible in re\fl-life \fppli\b\ftions. Hen\be, we h\fve me\fs\tred the effe\bt of spee\bh type mism\ft\bh in l\fng\t\fge re\bognition, \fs well \fs the improvements th\ft \b\fn be \f\bhieved with m\tlti-style tr\fining. In f\tt\tre work, we will try to develop more powerf\tl te\bhniq\tes to de\fl with the problem of spee\bh type mism\ft\bh.
